page.title: 17THE GREEN BELT AREA
page.content: The{green belt }area is{land}which is{protected}from being{built}on in order to{preserve}the{countryside. {There is}a{Green Belt}area near {Woodnook}extending to{Cutthorpe.}The builders of the{new houses}want the present{Green Belt boundary}moved so that they can build more houses up to {Woodnook Lane.}Most people in the area think that any new houses would{spoil {the surrounding}countryside which is pleasant & rich in{wildlife.}The lane & wood area is used for{walking and {other recreations.}A{public enquiry about the movement of the{Green belt {was}held in the{Town Hall}in{March {1985.}The{local residents}sent{letters {objecting}to the{plans}and attended the enquiry. A decision has now been made by the boundary commission and the{green belt}is expected to follow the same line in the near future.
